review_title: Cerritos College is just like any other community college. It's not bad and pretty fun.
job_title: Full Time Instructor in Norwalk, CA
pros:
No classes on Fridays. If you don't want to work summer, you will have 3 months of non-paid vacation.
Decent school.  Once you get tenure, you are set!  I personally enjoy the fact that Cerritos College has a culinary school. The lunch options here are great! They have all these gourmet style lunches for cheap. Always look for colleges with culinary schools if you want great food. Cerritos is one of them! Cerritos is located in a great area. If you work here and live here you have access to Witney (sp?) high school. If you are planning to raise a family of academics, a great high school to send your kids. The Artesia area is very diverse with an Indian/Chinese/Korean community. Lots of great ethnic food. There are a lot of different activities to do in this area.
cons: Growth rate is slow. Not as much pay as private industry.  One might have to deal with departmental and division politics. Not sure how bad it gets across the school. Science, Engineering, and Mathemetics (SEM) is a large division and so its probably more complicated, but also since there is more people, there is less personal confrontations? Not sure. As a full time instructor one needs to be on some committee so if one doesn't want to waste time on those things, one is out of luck. The paper work at the end of the semester is a pain to deal with, but from my experience, its the same pretty much elsewhere. Just hope you don't get too many bad students in your class. Luckily, there hasn't been any crazy nut jobs out there.

pros: Good working environment and staff are nice
cons: None None None None None

pros: Very fun position,  Working with students can be very rewarding! Schedule comes out just a few weeks before the start of the semester and can change every semester so you get late notice on if/when you are working.
cons: Department is a little hectic at times must be able to motivate students and work in a fast paced environment!   Working with mostly all girls can be challenging.  However since a license and years of experience are required for this position, the person applying must love the industry and must love teaching!   Students are challenging and in this industry tend to be outspoken and emotional.  Having lots of patience and and learning motivational techniques will help out.

review_title: I had a good experience working at Cerritos College.
pros: Cerritos is a great place to work if you are a student there, or if you live close by. They treat you nicely (generally), and it is pleasant most of the time.
cons: I cannot think of any cons to working at Cerritos College. As mentioned before, I think it is great if you are already taking classes there. Working at Cerritos College will not give you the ability to "move up" in your career, at least from what I've seen. In that regard, that is the only con I can think of.

pros: Most faculty who teach in a California Community college love to teach, and such people make extraordinary colleagues, lifelong friends.  The majority of instructional deans, the next level up, earnestly want to create conditions conducive to education.  Those in higher administrative positions are mixed:  some seek money; others relish the authority and power; still others use the posting to launch into different, more lucrative fields; a few are just right, people who love teaching, love colleagues, love students, and are possessed of a cogent, effective vision that benefits education.  But by far the most important thing about a community college is the students, for they arrive in each class with hope and with the belief that furthering their education will improve their lot in life.  Some enter with trepidation, for past experiences in education have wounded them, left them diminished and leery of faculty and doubtful of their own capabilities.  Some come with attitude, usually the kind of thing that adds character and excitement to the class – and insight and wisdom, if a teacher knows how to reach gently into the source.  Some work so many jobs or such nocturnal hours outside of the college that they end up bailing on the course.  But every single student enters a math class, say, or a writing class with two paramount hopes:  first, that the class will help them be better at math or a better writer, and, second, that the person getting paid to teach the class is not an idiot.  For a teacher, the job is heaven.
cons: As with any institution relying on many people to function properly, there are personalities that grate.  Proportionately, however, there are far, far fewer such pills at a community college than just about anywhere else on earth.

review_title: The only compensation in getting treated this badly would be pay. Which we don't get.
pros:

pros: Working for Cerrios College is amazing. They have great benefits and compensation for full-time employees. It was a true honor working for them and I wouldn't ever mind working for them again. People at Cerritos College really care about the students educational goals and always strive to give them their all.
cons: No cons that I could think of, Cerritos College is a great college.
